user_review: My mum and I both got the Mumbai Bowl for takeout, which consists of organic brown rice, chickpea & potato curry, pakoras (fried spiced chickpea balls), paratha (puffed Indian bread with veggie butter), mint & tamarind chutneys, and carrot. The food was flavorful and hearty, and the serving size was huge - enough to make a voracious eater like me feel full for hours! Definitely recommend this dish if you go to Aux Vivres. Service is friendly and price is reasonable, especially for such a large serving. They also have a small grocery section where they sell many desserts, whole cakes, cookies, sauces, refrigerated/frozen meals, stews, burgers, nuts, tempeh, etc.

Easily the best vegan brunch I have ever had. I only wish there was a place like this closer to where I live!My sister and I have now been here three times--once back in May and twice while visiting Montreal last weekend. It's our absolute favorite because the food is SO. GOOD. The brunch portions are huge and filling. All of the food is so delicious that you'll forget you're eating vegan. I highly recommend the polenta with beans. For anyone who is skeptical of vegan food, YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE. It will change your mind. Guaranteed.The space is clean and cute. Plenty of seating. Great atmosphere. Typically a young crowd--both as staff and customers. Nice plants around as decor. All of the staff is bilingual in French and English.
Awesome food and great waitstaff. Go for the smoothies and the poutine!Prices were fair and the selection was good for non vegans too

I loved mostly everything that I've tried here. It's great that the menu isn't overwhelming yet has just the perfect number of options within various cuisines. I'll go one by one over all the dishes I've tried in my 3-4 visits here.1. Poutine - Absolutely delightful sauce, I am not a big poutine fan & this one wasn't like anything I've had before. If you dig the real cheesy poutine, you should rather skip this dish. The potatoes weren't cut like fries but wedges. This dish was 5/5 for me.2. Mumbai Burger - Another delightful dish, completely influenced by Indian preparation, even has a hint of tamarind sauce on it. I could totally go back for this. Another 5/5.3. Mexicali Burrito Plate - Didn't quite appreciate the burrito but loved guac and everything else on the plate. 3.5/54. Chana Paratha - Typical Indian dish, amazing flavors. Completely loved the flavor of bread, which has a touch of garlic on it, slight improvisation on the typical indian bread 5/5.5. Malai Kofta - I was expecting a little too much of it after trying their chana, due to that I'd give it a 3.5/5. The gravy was great, kofta could get better.6. Berry Uncheesecake - I just couldn't believe that it was an uncheese version of cheese cake. One of the best un"cheese"cake I've ever had. 7/5. A total winner!P.S. They are a little better than the Aux Vivres Westmount ;)

I finally came to Aux Vivres after hearing such great things about this place. It's one of the first vegan restaurants in Montreal so we were excited to try it. Unfortunately, we left a little disappointed.The menu is pretty basic: soup, salads, sandwich, burgers, etc. There was nothing new to try - except maybe the faux lox. Overall, we thought it was a little pricey for what it was. We ordered the lox sandwich and salad deluxe. Both were tasteless and didn't have anything special to it. The sandwich was big but came with no side. Also, the ingredients in the salad didn't really go well all mixed together (I.e. guacamole + faux lox), itd be probably better to eat it all separately. Overall, it's a good place when you can't find vegan food near by. But I wouldn't consider it a "must do" in Montreal.

One of my favorite casual spots in Montreal!! The food was amazing and the outdoor seating was so comfortable. Visited this place a couple of times during my travels in Montreal and enjoyed it so much.

Aux Vivres has great vegan options. I had a hard time deciding what to get because the menu all sounded very good, but ended up getting the Dragon Bowl, which I was very happy with. If I lived in Montreal, I would definitely be a regular. Friendly staff speaks English, so I had no problem ordering. Great location and overall great experience!

An amazing vegan place! My bro in law recommended this place and although eggs are a big part of my breakfast/brunch, I didn't miss it for a second after eating here. It was a busy morning when we arrived and were told it would be a 10 Mins wait (in reality it was more like 20). We got seated soon and our servers came to us right away. I ordered the matcha latte and it was probably the strongest one I have ever had. It was pretty rich and I enjoyed it quite a lot. For food we got the Mumbai bowl and the rancheros. The rancheros came with tofu (although it was tastier than tofu, hence i wonder if was paneer) and was a good enough quantity. I never ended up finishing it but it was my next day's breakfast! Their menu is extensive and has options from all over the world. I have not enjoyed a vegan place as much as I did this one hence without a second thought this deserves a 5 Star!

#veganI had three experiences with this place during my recent trip to Montreal. It was a place I walked to in hopes to get a smoothie and cheesecake - seemed to be highly recommended online. At first I walked into the restuarant, but soon learned the take out spot is a few doors down, great idea! It is a bit of a mini store with some grab n go/grocery items and then the take out menu. I got the chocolate peanut butter cheesecake, berry cheesecake and mango lassi. The chocolate PB cheesecake was definitely worth it, I quite enjoyed that delicious treat. The berry cheesecake was ok, I prefer a light say cherry drizzle over my cheesecake while this had a thick dense fruit thickness on top of the cheesecake. I intended to get the creamsicle smoothie as I read about it but when I asked what the most popular smoothie was they said the mango lassi. So glad I got that, so sweet and SO DELICIOUS. Later that evening we actually ordered from here again, as they participate in Uber Eats. I got a salad and a BLT. The salad was alright. The BLT.... not as expected. It was both good and not so good. Mostly it was alot of wrap and alot of lettuce with tomato and then tons of coconut bacon flakes. Just didnt feel like it had the substance I was looking for and could have used some more sauce. We walked back again for another mango lassi though!!! The vegan mango lassi is a must. The cheesecake is worth a try and the food, Id try it again. The people were also very pleasant. The prices are fair enough.

31% of Indians are vegetarian, yet for some reason it's hard to find incredible Indian food that's vegetarian in Montreal without it just being "yeah we took the chicken out and added, I don't know, cauliflower?"Finally I found it at Aux Vivres. I realise I'm going to sound like a total hippy here, but I was looking for a light vegetarian lunch before my acupuncture appointment (I have anxiety, and it seemed like it might help.)I ordered the starter Chana Paratha and a side of potato wedges with chipotle mayo. The Chana Paratha was thick and incredibly flavourful, with more spice than I was expecting. I was glad to see it wasn't watery or weak, but instead, hearty and delicious, full of chickpeas and peas, and very filling for a $6.50 small meal. The wedges were good, with a light vegan mayo that was a little less thick than egg mayo but still basically the same thing (you can even buy it in shops!). Pretty good portion sizes, too - I'm glad I didn't get a bowl meal because it probably would have been too much for lunch!The service was fast despite my table being hidden behind a 4 foot wall, which was a relief, and despite being full I got a table pretty quickly. I'm excited to come back here! It's not quite as groundbreakingly delicious as Cafe Resonance's much smaller all-vegan menu but it's definitely going in my regular rotation.

I've been craving the Aux Vivres brunch for a while now and today was the perfect day for a pic nic brunch take out. I had the polenta platter and it was everything i had remembered, so delicious, flavorful i already can't wait to go back. It was a beautiful Hot day and it was perfect take out to take to Parc Mont-Royal bonus it was still hot by the time i got there...

I'm slightly disappointed at my experience here considering the amount of good reviews. Came here for brunch on a Sunday with friends and got the huevos rancheros. The textures and flavors were.. interesting. The tortilla were quite hard and difficult to cut through. The flavors were abit strange and the textures as well. Maybe because it was vegan? But I'm sure you can make vegan ingredients work for this dish. The guacamole was not creamy enough and the little paper cup of ranch or whatever dressing seemed cheap. Overall, very unexciting but it satisfied my brunch craving at least.

Yo ya boy done gone hadda do it to em n go INTERNATIONAL baby gurrrrlllllll. Me n my mamacita said boy howdy do we wanna git it in wit da vegan treat up in American Paris n some of da Frenchmen said yo peep this place son in like frensh or some stuff yo. So ya boy done gone hop in the metro from that drapeau parc of whatever n head to the jawn n get the munch bro. I went up in dat jam n we sat down n homegirl said some frensh gibberish n I order my jawn wit da glutenburg beer n it was muy delicioso as they say in Montreal. I got sum salad wit like peanuts or granola or sonethin n it was ok but not great. Still had a bomb ass time n ya boy done held it down for the USA.

The best veggie restaurant in Montreal. Was the 3rd time i ate here and it's always super good.  I taste aux vivre burger and it was really good a hearty garden patty with onions, tomatoe and lettuce but its chipotle sauce that makes it a winner with side of potatoes and  chipotle ketchup.But the best thing is the berry uncheese cake that we share. It's as good as cheeses cake. Simply delicious hard to believe it's not cheese.Service was a bit slow but was good.

One of the things that is difficult to find is a place for vegan brunch. Luckily Montreal has no such issue and Aux Vivres Plateau tops the list of spots.With the cozy diner feel and large portions of deliciousness you are not going to regret coming here. I fully endorse getting La Polenta which is essentially huevos rancheros with fried polenta instead of wedges.

Visited Aux Vivres during a recent trip to Montreal and this was, hands down, my favorite meal. Ordered The Complete during brunch (until 4pm in the weekends) which comes with tofu scramble, sausage, potatoes, corn bread, a small salad, and a chai (or coffee). Yes, I cleaned my plate and I have no shame because it was like a party in my mouth. The sausage had sweetness to it that went well with the saltiness of the scramble and everything came out hot and fresh. The green dressing they use on the salad has dill in it which gives it a pop of flavor. Menu is in English and French and staff is bilingual. The interior has kind of a diner-ish vibe, but very clean and bright. Highly recommend

I finally visited Aux Vivres after hearing so much about this place. I left feeling somewhat disappointed.I ordered the latke burger dressed with vegan tzatziki, tomato, pickle and lettuce on a whole wheat burger bun, served with potato wedges. There was a long hair on my plate under the burger so that wasn't a great start. I threw it away as a reflex before I could say anything to the waiter so that's on me. But how did they not catch that? The patty itself was made of sweet potatoes and beets so that was pretty yummy. I also liked their vegan tzatziki but their potatoes were bland and the pieces were way too large.My sister ordered the BLT that comes with coconut chips instead of bacon. The wrap was so huge she had to take half home and it doesn't even come with a side! She would have preferred if the wrap was half the size but with interesting sides like a soup & salad. I hated that they sat us near the window as it was way too hot there from the sun. The people who got to sit away from the windows were better off. The banquette side is pretty uncomfortable so I just wanted to leave the whole time. The service was great though. Fast, friendly, polite. The food legit came out within 5 mins!We shared a large berry smoothie, which was delicious and refreshing. We also tried the banana chocolate pie; it was rich and decadent. Yum. I just wish that instead of a coconut crust, it was a graham cracker one. They should describe it or make it more clear on the menu.So overall, I feel like the menu relies too heavily on soy substitutes (tofu & tempeh) to replace animal products, unlike at Green Panther, Crudessence, Lola Rosa, etc. I'll probably give their new Westmount location a try when it opens since it's so close to me but I think if I'm craving healthy, I'll just go to Mandy's or Green Panther. Great option for vegans though!

We took the BLT wrap and the tempeh skewers. Seriously can't eat them. The tempeh tasted so weird. Definitely not my cup of tea. The coconut bacon basically just tasted like sweet coconut with a bit of a reddish color. It was too sweet to be put in a wrap. There wasn't much ambiance in the restaurant. It just felt like eating in a cafeteria. The staff isn't that friendly. Overall, we didn't enjoy it and wouldn't go back.

We ordered a tempeh wrap, tempeh tacos, carrot cake and berry cheesecake. Everything was solid. I recommend going next door to the "to-go" store and getting a a whole cake instead of one overpriced piece in the full service restaurant. We ended up purchasing an apple chocolate cake to have later. It was amazing! So moist and addictive!The coffee was a rip off. My friend ordered it and besides that fact that it was not good, it came in a very small mug that wasn't even poured to capacity. It cost $2.50 and refills weren't free!Th atmosphere was not great, but the restaurant was clean and cute. I would go back, for sure, but the to-go store is where it's at! You can purchase most of what's on the restaurant menu in the store.

The photos look way more fancy and upscale than it actually is. Just picture a diner with friendly staff, and really good comfort food and then add the miracle that it's vegan friendly. It's always cold and rainy when I come to Montreal and the first place I go is Aux Vivres for a coconut bacon BLT wrap and a hot coffee. They're proof positive that it doesn't take much to run a great restaurant beyond a little bit of effort in preparing your menu and a welcoming attitude.

Where healthy, vegetarian dishes meet flavour and equality.A couple of bites from our full experience review - "Although the Le Creamsicle ingredient combination sounded odd, it turned out to be a beautiful smoothy - tasting a lot like a cream popsicle. All you candy lovers out there - this is your healthy version.""The tempeh patty was surprisingly juicy with a bean texture and slightly grilled smell. We enjoyed the burger with classic toppings and the coleslaw side turned out to be quite a treat - finely chopped with a beautiful spiciness coming through via the horse reddish."

Wonderful! Great place, and the dinner was a banger. Got a burger, and it was delicious. The slaw is insanely good, and then ended with a piece of the chocolate peanut butter cheesecake and that was excellent. Might not trade my first born for a burger here, but a close young relative no doubt

The food is subpar in this place. In the name of vegan, everything is tasteless. Whole lot of peanut sauce in everything -- which is ok but no other taste. We ordered the Thai Tacos and Thai bowl. Absolute nothing Thai about them. The dragon sandwich is huugggge but the bread/pita wasn't even cooked. Tasted like we were eating raw flour. Ah well, came here only cuz had a gift card. Never again.

Great value and delicious brunch for both vegans and their omnivore friends! Brunch comes with a free coffee or chai latte, which is a nice treat. Pictured: the heuvos rancheros and "smoked salmon" wrap

I NEED TO STEAL THIS RESTAURANT & TRANSPLANT IT INTO TORONTO/GTA. Montreal's first vegan restaurant and definitely one of the BEST I've ever tried. They have a huge menu where EVERYTHING is vegan and I don't have worries on 'hm, would this have egg/dairy in it?' ..needless to say, it's so blessed. We ate here pretty much daily on our montreal trip and we were so so so happy with it. Service is top notch and they're super friendly AND bilingual. Bless. Food came out very quickly too. The menu is HUUUGE and I wanted to eat everything, to be honest. I was sad that I didn't get to try the blueberry pancakes for brunch. I did try the BLT made with coconut bacon and the portions made my inner fat kid extremely happy.. it was pretty much good enough for two people. I'm used to the vegan restaurants in the greater toronto area charging people $30 for a lettuce leaf so when the food came, you can tell I was a happy child.. I couldn't even finish more than half of the thai bowl. In addition to that, heir food is very high quality & definitely fresh.The star of the show is definitely their desserts - if you're vegan, you definitely feel me on this one: it's SOOOO difficult to find vegan desserts just anywhere. I definitely took advantage. Did I order vegan cheesecake (gateau faux-mage .. so cute) for brunch dessert? You bet the hell I did! It was definitely just like real cheesecake and unbelievably creamy. Um yes, please. Can someone please make this for me back home?!?!? I crave it, just thinking about it and I don't even like sweets, so wtf? Definitely one of my top must-visits whenever I come back to mtl.

This is by far my favourite restaurant in Montreal, OR at least one of them. And I'm NOT EVEN VEGAN (nor am I vegetarian). The first thing I ever tried from here were their potato wedges. Tofu burger. Dragon bowl. Their chili is quite good, too. Eating there with friends is a wonderful experience. Always a good time.

Whilst in town for a music festival, we needed a quick healthy kick in the gut. Aux Vivres served up a satisfying brunch full of health. We started with a Juice and coffee. The Juice was so hearty I could've had it as a meal on its own. The coffee was good and strong but note they're not keen on giving free refills on your cup. Most places had a wait for brunch but there is an enormous amount of seating here so we got in quickly and scored a corner booth.I had a quinoa scramble meal. It was incredibly fresh and made me feel clean without feeling like I had to eat cardboard. Win!

Everything i've tried here is amazing. Their desserts, their food, the teas, the juices, all of it yummy. The prices are reasonable and the staff always friendly. One of the best vegetarian spots in Mtl

Excellent vegan dinner. So many options on the menu we had trouble deciding. My husband and I enjoyed the Mexican plate and Mumbai bowl and a beer. Everything was excellent and the service was great too!

Simply amazing vegan food! The BLT chapati sandwich was massive - the coconut bacon definitely stole the show. We also ordered the chilli fries. Both are must-tries. You can tell everything is made with fresh and quality ingredients. A homey diner feel with bomb indie/soul musicOnly downside is that service was incredibly slow (worth the wait though!)

So when I travel I always look up the best food in the area. This place was on the top of the list for vegan food and I hopped in an uber and came straight here.The concept of the food is what got me. They're food is an Indian Mediterranean fusion, and you could taste it in the food. The spot is very homey, and the servers were really prompt. Also price wise- very affordable!I got the coconut bacon BLT because that's what I read was good, but it personally wasn't my favorite dish at the table. It was too little bacon and too much lettuce for my preference. But wow at the rest of the food- the tempeh in peanut sauce, the La Companion brunch plate, and everything else. Just wow. Please go here if you want large portions of really great food!! Ive never eaten a tempeh dish made this well!

Save room for dessert on this review.* * *This is a vegan restaurant with lumberjack portions.One meal here and you will not have to eat again all  day.Individual dishes range between four and five stars.I had an absolutely first rate vegan chili - with soy cream and lots of garnishes and a lot of high quality tortilla chips.The bowl was the size of half a bowling ball.The chili substantially exceeded Texas chili standards - and I should know being a Texan.Vegan chili has no meat and meat is the essence of a successful chili.Most vegan chili has to work hard to qualify for "that's nice dear".This was the real Texas stuff and was a downright pleasure to eatEven if no cow was actually hurt in the making of this production.* * *My wife's Thai bowl was just okay.This was another half-bowling-ball bowl filled with grains, tempeh, and vegetables cut too large to conveniently get in your mouth and eat.Flavor? Meh.* * *A first course of gazpacho was better than Health Food Store Gazpacho and worse than Barcelona Gazpacho. Nearly every health food store makes a gazpacho in the summer, and they may as well call it"Cold and Insipid Tomato Soup - But Eat It - Its Good For You".This was better than that.  It had good tomatoes. It had personality. It had its own non-standard taste. (I suspect a serrano pepper was lurking in the background).It had cilantro which I personally can't stand.But the vegan at the table who came with me to insure fair judgment of cilantro dishes Told me that - even giving the cilantro a break - the soup wasn't that great.Give it a B.* * *Now for the accomplishment of this kitchen.Dessert.One of the dishes is a chocolate apple cake.This is a purely vegan cake with zucchini as a binder and flaxseed taking the place of egg.There are a lot of vegan restaurants that try dishes of this ilk.The result tends to be a sodden heavy mess.In contrast, this was an intriguing fascinating dessert.The apple taste was very subtle but it was there, giving the cake lightness and personality.The cake was delightfully moist.It had fascinating flavor.Is it as good as a cake from the finest patisserie in Paris? No.But it leaves Moosewood and Rainbow Collective and Casa de Luz cakes far back in the pack.I admire the technical skill of the baker of working out the exact proportions of these recondite ingredients to make the cake a textural and flavor success.* * *So if you need to eat your healthy vegetables, this is a great place to do it.Zucchini in your main course.Zucchini in your dessert.

Aux vivres is a classic vegan/vegetarian restaurant with many delicious meals. As you walk in no matter the time of day it always seems to be PACKED! It's located north of st laurent. Easy street meter parking. The atmosphere is very "homey" and healthy. A lot of hipster/hippie people my kind of resto. It feels like a dinner but an upscale one. I usually get one of their bowls this time I had their popular dragon bowl with tofu. DEELICIOUS. I got the tempeh before but it feels very dry and sandy and you can taste the soy bean powder after taste. You can't go wrong with the tofu. Their vinaigrette is to die for. I also shared their chilli and nachos. Loveeeeee the guacamole oh mahh goodness was it amazing. I love coming here it makes me feelSain and healthy. They also serve alcohol but its very limited. They only have 3 cocktails on the menu and I tried the mimosa hmm kind of regret it :/ it was super sourish and bitter with freshly squeezed orange though. Service wise: very slow at times but its understandable with the amount of orders they need to handle. The waitress was super friendly and patient. She really catered to us and came around often. Overall, you cant go wrong with aux vivres its a fantastic little gem in the mile end of montreal fabulous and will definitely be back when I feel like being healthy again ahaha

I stopped by this wonderful small vegan spot to try out one of their awesome smoothies. Aux Vivres has two sections...the resto where you can have a sit down meal and the takeout section. The smoothies come in 6 flavors and are truly delicious! I tried the mango smoothie which was pefect for a warm summer day. The ingredients are fresh and the smoothies themselves are refreshing and so tasty! Will defintaely be back!
I'm Vegan one of my favorite restaurants Staff extra friendly !

Some years back, I got the pleasure of visiting Aux Vivres. The ambience was wonderful and hip (do people use that word any more?). It wasn't too busy for a Saturday night, and it wasn't too cramped even for our big group. Although I was immersed in a French country, the English menu and atmosphere made me feel like I was back home again (The US). Afree going over the menu extensively, I ordered the Thai Bowl with Grilled Tempeh. I am not sure (nor was I able to put my finger on it) but I wasn't "wowed" by it. I still enjoyed it especially once the dressing was smothered on every delicate green and orange veggie, but if I ever get another chance to visit again, I am gonna try something else. My other "amis" (aka friends) really enjoyed their cuisine, so I guess I was the only one that thought my dish was "just okay"- The ambience and location gets a 5- My dish gets a 4I say it's still worth checking out, so if you are ever in town, head over there and bon apetite!
Étonnant! Amazing food and great service :)First vegan experience in a restaurant, will come back again !

[Montreal Food Tour Stop #8]  A great selection of vegan food, which not only includes salads but also juices, smoothies, tempeh, tofu, burgers made from tempeh or tofu, alcoholic beverages, and rice bowls.  I needed something healthy to counter all of the poutine, pastries, and desserts that I had been eating in Montreal.  This restaurant isn't quite in downtown, but it was worth the cab ride from downtown.  It's nice to be pleasantly full, but still comfortable because the food is all relatively healthy.Highlights: I ordered the tempeh burger, which comes with a vegan coleslaw and a side of potato wedges.  It's been a long time since I've had tempeh, and that last experience was in a college dining hall.   Eating the tempeh burger here gave me a fresh perspective - that a vegan burger patty can actually taste good.  The patty (more shaped like a rectangular slab) was very moist, unlike the first time I ate tempeh.  There was a tasty spread on the sandwich.  I liked how the burger was served with potato wedges instead of fries.  The vegan coleslaw was very light. Critiques: Bread for the burger was just okay, in my opinion.  I also ordered a mango lassi, which was decent but average.  The drink tasted differently from what you would get at an Indian restaurant.Overall: If you're vegan, this place is awesome.  Carnivores may still prefer real meat over the vegan burgers, but the dishes were well executed and a nice change of pace from fried food and buttery pastries.

Since I'm GLUTEN and DAIRY free, this is seriously the only place where I can confidently dine at in Montreal while knowing I won't feel a little off the next day. I frequent AV around once a month but now that it's getting nice out I'll make the walk here probably once a week. It's the closest I can be to eating at home if not healthier. They take cross contamination and food allergies seriously and their food is just plain healthy, which makes for a healthy Yelper.My favorite dishes here are the small house and the BLT Caesar. Their lentil soup has been hit or miss but I'm not sure if it's the soup or me (sometimes I am pickier than other times if you know what I mean)I love their thick cut roasted potato wedges, smoothies, and gluten free desserts too!Gluten free and Dairy free Montreal peeps PLEASE PM ME with any similar restaurants that have no cross contamination like these guys do. I'm at a loss but this seems to be it for me thus far. Help me out y'all.

You know that feeling when someone hugs you, but the hug is a little bit too long? You begin to get uncomfortable, but then you find yourself tearing up. You realize it's been awhile since someone held you like that, and it's warm and it's comforting and you feel so incredibly safe in their arms. Then suddenly you realize it's been you that's been holding the hug for too long, and you gently release them, feeling like you can finally exhale. That's what it's like to eat at Aux Vivres.
Some of the best food I've ever had. The staff was great and the food was sooo fresh. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Montreal. A+

Plesantly surprised! We tried a variety of things. I have the Latke Burger. It was okay, not the best, everything was falling out and slightly bland. My boyfriend had the Dragon sandwhich/wrap which was amazing and HUGE! We were worried it would be small and not filling but wow... He eats alot and half was already enough. All the sauces were amazing and tasty you wouldn't even know they're vegan. I loved the tempeh, especially since I hate tofu.
Had the dragon bowl and it was amazing! Great mixture of vegetables and very tasty sauce. Also beautiful presentation and the grilled tempeh is so good!!

It's so cool to have this in Montreal - be warned: come in starving because their portion sizes are large and the food is too good to not finish. The fifth missing star is for a lack of attentive service.

Delicious vegan food right in the middle of the plateau. Although I'm not a fan of the lighting (very fluorescent and uncomfortable), the food is really good. My favorite is the chili on potatoes, served with a cashew cream cheese. So delicious! Their brunch blueberry pancakes are also very good, though I wish they had a bigger brunch section!

Bombay banana smoothie was very interesting, pretty good, but my sister absolutely loves it. It contains banana and chocolate but is strongly spicy, tasting of masala and ginger. Malai kofta balls were good, also spicy. Now...the real thing... Dragon sandwich with grilled tempeh is DA REAL BOMB!! 5 stars on the very first bite. Huge portions, fresh ingredients, and warm bread wrap. Normally not a big fan of tempeh, but it was absolutely fantastic here.Great, friendly service.

I've been to Aux Vivres more times than its worth counting for over the years. That being said, I've seen this place change somewhat radically in terms of atmosphere, food and service, which makes it all the harder to review. At another time I could count on a quality Mekong sandwich large enough to be shared between two broke folks- now I find the lunch and dinner quantities underwhelming and the sauce overbearing. Definitely not the kind of meal to be shared. This is also accompanied by a different atmosphere- it's not the intimate little vegan nook it once was.I wouldn't recommend visiting the joint for anything other than brunch- which is the only legit. vegan brunch I can really vouch for in the city (check out that perfectly cooked polenta!).
Tasty and interesting! I definitely recommend the Thai bowl with tempeh. This place is great for vegans and non-vegans!
Aux Vivres has an odd mix of food (Indian, Mediterranean, American), but all of it is great. I am a big fan of Chana masala, so I had the Mumbai bowl which was amazing. Definitely recommend!
I went here about a year ago. I am not a vegan but I do like ot eat vegan here and there. I really did not enjoy their food at all. Everything tasted the same. Cooper branch is wayyyy better.

Outstanding! Living here for a few years I've heard so much about this place, but was never Ballsy enough to go. Now that I've become 'vegetarian' for a while, I decided this would be the perfect opportunity to and lemme tell y'all - I was extremely impressed. I got the tempeh peanut butter skewers as an appetizer and those were very good and flavourful. Then for the main dish I chose the Mumbai bowl which comes with a curry, pakoras and naan bread. Everything was seasoned and spiced so well, I ended up with major itis and kept some go have later on today. I'm very very impressed!

How much do I absolutely adore Aux Vivre? Enough to go daily... and twice in one day! They boast such a vibrant menu chock full of both healthy and indulgent vegan dishes, plus desserts, smoothies and juices, that any vegan/vegetarian/omnivore should be satisfied. What I love the most:-Popeye juiceIt's so gingery and refreshing! Even if you're the type who suffers through their glass of green juice if it's super green, this one is sure to change your mind. -La Polenta (on the brunch menu-- available only on the weekend)My god, this plate is absolutely what the doctor ordered. It's hearty and delicious, with big hunks of tasty polenta over refried beans + zesty tofu scramble(cooked with nutritional yeast), perfect guac and salad (that dilly dressing is dreamy). The perfect plate if you don't actually eat until the mid afternoon when you realize you're fucking starving. -Buddha BowlIt's simply a huge bowl, abundant with veggies, rice and grilled tofu that is out of this world delicious. But what really takes it to the next level is that ramekin of Buddha sauce (think: umami and not sweet!)And this may not seem like a big deal to you, but their soy cappuccinos are perfection. Coming from an espresso fanatic!This is more of a note for me and shouldn't discourage you at all, but I wasn't crazy about the the BLT because I prefer a more savory fake bacon, maybe made of tempeh, rather than the sweet coconut variety, also way too much mayo. The wrap isn't my favorite kind, but that's because I'm weird about wraps and probably shouldn't order them. But! My friend couldn't go on ENOUGH about how spectacular the Dragon wrap is and just know that it holds up to the next day as she took it to go! Final note: The key lime pie is disappointing. To be fair, I took it to go and perhaps it just needs to be eaten immediately, but it appeared rather unappetizing when I first received it and when I went to eat it later, I found it inedible (mainly because the texture is too gelatinous). I'm sure their other desserts are much better! They appear quite enticing, for sure.Besides the great options for all and the fact that Aux Vivre is Montreal's very first vegan restaurant (kudos, mes amis!) I want to note that I just love every waitress I've ever had here. They are the sweetest girls and really take good care of you, even when you're there, ahem, past closing (sorry to be THAT table, but thank you, Aux Vivre, for being open so late because *this* vegan often doesn't sit down to dinner til 10pm!)

I had heard so many great things about Aux Vivres (and I absolutely LOVE their tzatziki), so I was disappointed to walk in and find it to be more of a "diner" than an actual "restaurant".  It's definitely more of a casual place for a quick bite than somewhere I would go on a date night.  Sadly, there are not many other vegan options in Montreal yet, so despite our trepidation, we stayed to try the food.Our waitress was very friendly and efficient.  She knew the menu well and was able to suggest a great organic beer for me and a smoothie for my husband that he practically finished in one gulp it was so good.  She also suggested a delicious curry soup that both my husband I and I loved - the Chana  Paratha appetizer did not go over as well.  After that, we opted for burgers, my husband choosing the seitan burger and I took the Aux Vivres burger.  Both were under-cooked and mushy and the roasted potato wedges they were served with seemed like they were yesterday's leftovers; coldish and soggy.  I bet they would have been delicious if they were served fresh & hot from the oven.Tables were TINY and very cramped - we could barely fit our food and drinks on our little table for two, so I had to keep using the empty table beside me.  I would have liked to try some of the delicious-looking desserts, but we were feeling claustrophobic in our tiny cramped booth, so we   skipped dessert.Probably won't be back :-(
Fantastic brunch!! WOW!Haven't had much of their lunch/dinner options but the Dragon Sauce is the best.

Love the old diner feel this place has. I came for dinner one time, ordered the Buddha bowl with the tempeh, along with a dahl soup to start, and was pleased with it all. The bowl is simple, with an assortment of veggies, and a tasty sauce. Nothing mind-blowing, but I was very satisfied. Recommended.

Meh, try once kinda place. I love vegetarian food and all but just wasn't feeling this place you know? We came right when they were open so maybe the kitchen wasn't ready yet so my sandwich took awhile to come out. I saw the BLT sandwich on Yelp and it looks so good. They saw us struggling reading French so they finally gave us an English menu. They should just always leave out English menu! |BLT sandwich| 11.25 CAD About $8 US money for a sandwich is not bad considering it's vegetarian. So they replaced the bacon with coconut pieces that had a lot of flavor on its own but too dry for a sandwich. We bought a small box of it on the side for our road trip and it tastes better as a snack. What its lacking was the sauce. It was too dry with all 3 ingredients: coconut pieces, lettuce, tomatoes. I'm glad I shared and only had half of it. Could barely make it through.

This review may not reflect the quality of the food since this was my first vegan experience as a non vegan. Therefore It only helps compare vegan with non vegan food and from my taste view!I had the BLT and it was a recommendation of a vegan friend who had enjoyed it already. Did not like it! They make coconut bacon which is neither. A semi sweet sandwich which is closer in essence to dessert than to main course.It also is pricy i say comparatively.Staff were nice and service was quite fast though.

Great vegan brunch  it was simply delicious! I personally loved the Huevos rancheros, but my boyfriend's polenta was also very good. You can see everything is freshly made.Good service. We will definitely go back.

The sandwich are okay, the portions are really big though. The tempeh was really good, especially the sauce coming with it. Planning on going back to taste other stuffs on their menuI was really impressed by the gateau fauxmage A MUST seriously. The staffs are really friendly

If you're looking for delicious and affordable vegan cuisine, this is my number one pick in the city. They recently expanded, due to the constant flow of people, which has really helped minimize lineups. The food is fantastic and offers a mix of Indian, Greek, Thai, Mexican and other inspired flavours - but all with the Aux Vivres twist. My usuals here are the curry lentil soup, the Thai & Dragon bowls with tempeh, the Thai choupati wrap and of course one of their fabulous desserts, notably the GF banana-chocolate torte or the apple-chocolate cake. Yum!

I support this place because it's fully vegan and offers an amazing menu. Nevertheless I wasn't completely convinced by the food. I ordered the Kosmos Plate, at 14.95 CAD the most expensive dish on the menu. Unfortunately the "souvlaki-style tempeh" didn't look or taste like souvlaki, the "pita' was anything but Greek pita, and the potato wedges were just not good and a bit on the raw side. The only thing worthy of its name was the tzatziki. As a half-Greek I can confirm that the taste was pretty close to the original. For dessert I ordered the "cheesecake" but that also didn't taste of much. I'm hoping I just made some poor choices and the rest of the menu is better executed. Maybe the breakfast options or the burgers will win me over next time. I'm not giving up on you Aux Vivres!

Generous portion, reasonable price and fresh ingredients. I had the buddha bowl (with tofu), which came in a large colorful bowl of veggies and rice.My only small complaint is that I wish he proportion of rice to veggies was more equal, as there was way too much rice and not enough veggies to balance it. However, the sauce was very good and complemented the meal well.   The price point was very reasonable. $11 for the sandwiches and $13-15 for the bowls. I wish i had the room to try their desserts as they looked so so good. Will definitely return to try the sandwiches and chocolate desserts !   P.S. Their menu is extremely extensive, so great place for non-vegan/vegetarians as well.

Stopped in for dessert and tea. Desserts were nothing special - cakes, cookies, and brownies. Was expecting something more creative. Carrot cake was a little dry but the chocolate desserts were a little better. Many other vegan options in town so I doubt I'd recommend this as a must-do.

The menu is extensive and I'm sure any vegan you take here will be happy and impressed with the options. However, the sandwiches are mostly lettuce and cost more than $11 - so that is never my order. I usually go for the dragon bowl or the veggie burger or the "soul food" mumbai plate - all of which I think are delicious.I've taken out of town visitors here who have been impressed with the menu - and they've enjoyed their meal! There is a nice terrace out the back for the summer months.I did have one ridiculous experience where I ordered the Chana Paratha, described in the menu as: spiced Indian flatbread topped with chana, sour cream, cilantro [now it seems to have changed to mint] & tamarind chutney. When it arrived with 2 cilantro leaves, I asked for a little more and they said they'd have to charge me .75cents. Sure, whatever. A plate arrived with one sprig of cilantro and another 2 leaves. At the same meal, they also charged us for extra dressing. The whole thing struck me as a little classless and a bit ridiculous; and having been a regular, kinda pissed me off. One star docked.The food is good and creative but if you've been going here for a few years, then you may remember when the staff were friendlier, the portions more generous and the prices lower...Second star docked.

user_city: Civic Hospital - Experimental Farm - Central Park, Canada
user_review: The best in Ontario and Quebec that I have had. Great tasting food and reasonably priced. Service is very good and atmosphere is pleasant for any type of outing. Always make it a stop when visiting Montreal. It is also in a great location.

I live in San Francisco and we are spoiled with vegan cuisine there so I was excited to try Montréal's 1st vegan restaurant! I brought an omnivore friend who lives here for Sunday brunch and we shared the Tempeh Satay, Hercules Salad w/Tofu & Huevos Rancheros. We each tried two juices. Then we had our own desserts (I'm gluten-free):  carrot cake for him and chocolate banana pie for me. The meal was wonderful. It was Frank's 1st time having tempeh so I was happy to find out your artisan tempeh was made locally.  I loved the tzatziki that came with the salad (I'm Greek!). So creamy!  The desserts were amazing!  So happy I tried you all out.  Highly recommended for casual dining.

The food was okay, nothing too crazy. I got the chilli and the thai tacos. The smoothie I got was delicious, however. Once it was time to pay, I paid with my card. I had planned to pay with my card, and tip with cash. So once I had hit the No Tip button on the card machine, and receipt printed, the waitress had told me I had forgot to tip. I'm new to Montreal, and didn't know if tipping was mandatory, until my cousin who is a local said what she did was rude. So 3 stars because the smoothie was good, but the customer service wasn't all that.

Let me start by saying that I'm a meat lover, which is the reason I can't give this restaurant 5 stars. Having said that, this place is sublime...they're food is absolutely delicious!A friend and I arrived a bit before 1pm on good Friday and the place was full, but they gave us a table within a few minutes. As the meat lover I am, I had a hard time navigating the menu so I asked the waitress for help and she helped me very diligently. My friend got the Dragon Bowl with tempeh and I got the Buddha Bowl with tempeh...I didn't even know what tempeh was! Food arrived and we devoured it, and I can stress how surprised vegan food can be so good! For dessert we even shared an "uncheesecake" (in French the pun was better, at "gateau au faux-mage") and however they make it, it tasted exactly like cheesecake. In the end, my friend and I each spent about $20.If you're a carnivore and you're looking for a small break from meat, or your date likes vegetarian/vegetalian food, this place will be appropriate!

I'm a health-conscious and open-minded omnivore with a vegetarian partner, so I've tried a lot of different vegetarian and vegan versions of things and been able to compare them with "the real thing". Sometimes they closely imitate the real thing. Sometimes they don't compare, but are still tasty. And sometimes they're a failure on the scale of Aux Vivre's veggie butter, which I think they must have really worked on to make sure it resembled actual butter in no way whatsoever. If you've ever wondered what corn bread would taste like with Asian salad dressing, Aux Vivres is for you!Aux Vivres makes to-go food that can be found in local groceries and markets. I recently picked up the BBQ Tempeh wrap, because I'd never had BBQ tempeh I didn't love, at least until that day. Would recommend this wrap for anyone who finds tofu just too flavourful. If I had to rate this tempeh's flavour on a scale of 1-5 where 5 is a plain hard-boiled egg and 1 is the tap water at my mom's house, I might give it a 0.75.Aux Vivres makes what my partner calls "California hippy vegan" food, the hallmarks of which are a fetishization of certain "superfoods", the vege bait-and-switch (it's just like regular butter, in the sense that both are yellow!), and a focus on the foods' health benefits at the expense of rich, full-bodied flavour. Definitely come here if you are looking for an interesting salad to Instagram, not so much if you're after comfort food.The redeeming quality that gave this review the extra star is Aux Vivre's Dragon Bowl, specifically Dragon Sauce, of which you can get a bottle to take home. Whatever Dragon Sauce is, it is delicious, and tastes vastly more like butter than whatever's in their veggie butter.

Alright let me start off by saying that Montreal's vegetarian scene is mad strong. And I'm only realizing this now that I'm away from all of my faves :(Anyway,  Aux Vivres always gives me these "I can't believe this meal has no meat" moments. The food is top-notch, super flavorful, and gets me to eat food I normally wouldn't (who knew tempeh is sooooo good??)My go-to meal used to be the polenta brunch, but then I stumbled upon the famous dragon bowl and never looked back. Honestly, if you don't know what to get, just go for this guy. It's full of flavor (the sauce is key) and also filling! I've gotten takeout from Aux Vivres, been to the restaurant, gone there for brunch, gone there for supper, had one of their premade bowls... I feel like I've experienced every aspect, and it's always been a good experience!

Solid vegan restaurant. Coming from Toronto it was nothing mind-boggling, but it was respectable. If you've never been to a vegan restaurant before you'll enjoy yourself.The gyro and the aux vivres burger were both good. A friend ordered the thai bowl and said it was disappointing.After all the rave reviews for the desserts on yelp I was fairly disapointed. Boyfriend and I shared the chocolate apple pie and the chocolate banana pie and they were both pretty meh.

I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan but sometimes you just need to eat healthy without having to compromise on taste.I came to Aux Vivres for the first time today, I don't know why it took me so long to try it since I've been hearing about this place for years from friends both in and out of the yoga scene (where they are all vegan practically these days). I usually have a lot of misgivings about veggie restos because sometimes the drinks taste like grass and the food is usually tofu or tempeh done up in such a way to hide the blandness of the meat substitute.I was actually quite surprised, I ordered the mango lassi, a large vegetarian chilli and tried out their choco-banana torte and it was all very tasty. All the tables around me had food like salads, sandwiches, chapati bread and it all looked super fresh and vibrant, people were clearly enjoying their food and lingering over their lunches with their friends. The vibe here is very casual and friendly and well-lit and bright.Next time I come, I'm bringing a big book so I can read while I try their coconut bacon in a sandwich and some of their other desserts because it's so chill here.

Well for a non vegan...let me tell up you that this place is excellent! I was brought in there by a friend to try it out and what a surprise!! I loved every piece of my meal: I got the brown rice bowl Dragon and I have to say it was delicious. We also got te chocolate banane pie at the end which we swallowed in 2 bites ;) overall excellent service and food, don't hesitate to go!
This place is so amazing! The vegan food is so delicious and everything just melts in your mouth. Just delectable and always busy for a reason.

This place on St. Laurent needs no introduction or review. It has its own fan following already, vegans or non-vegans, everyone is crazy about it. I wonder why I forgot to review it earlier. Have been there multiple times. Perfect recipes with a huge variety and good service. It is one of my favorite sunday brunch places. They serve brunch specials with free coffee or tea. Each if their dishes are prepared with a good mix of protein, carbs and fats to start your day, in addition to being presented beautifully.I am super happy with all the wonderful vegan tasty options I have here.

​​I've never been to a completely vegan establishment before since I'm an omnivore, but a friend of ours suggested us this place while we were visiting and I thought, why not.Can't explain how surprised I was ​by the deliciousness of things. We only came for coffee ​and a dessert, but still. Maybe if we return some day I'll order a main dish as well (or just a ton of desserts), but for now...... the desserts were amazingly good (not cheap though, keep that in mind). I had the Gâteau Faux-Mage. Heavenly! Seriously​!​ It was waaaaay better than a typical cheesecake you can order anywhere else.​ I'd kill to have the recipe and be able to ​make it at home ​myself ​over and over.Husband ordered Apple Pie which was great as well, but the Uncheesecake got me so bad I hardly wanted to try his dessert. :)Coffee came with almond milk and so did my Earl Grey tea. Both great.This place has very friendly staff. They speak English and menu has two sides - French and English. What ​​more could one want? I'd give them 10 stars if I could. :)​

Great service and tasty food! The server was friendly and informative. Maybe one of the best servers I've ever had. The food came lightning fast (it wasn't a particularly busy time of day, but still) and was delicious. I had the burger with fries. My friend had the wrap special of the day. Overall a great experience.

This place has almost a cult following for its coconut bacon alone, but the rest of the food selections are equally rich in character, and delicious. I've been here a couple of times and always leave stuffed and completely satisfied. It's decently affordable, too. The juices will give you *super powers* (just kidding, but it feels like that when you drink it), the servings are really substantial and there's excellent selection, whether you're vegan or not. I've gotten chana paratha, which is an entree but was plenty enough eats for me, along with a juice (although I wasn't starving when I got there). I've also gotten the Assiette Mumbai, which was simple fare, and also really tasty and satisfying - seems I have a thing for chickpeas. Next time I go, I'm trying their famed Dragon Bowl. Honestly, you can't go wrong here. The staff is sparkling, there's a ton of seating and you're being good to your body with every bite.

I had been wanting to go to Aux Vivres for years, and after the build-up, the disappointment seemed inevitable. Now, I don't like either rice or tempeh, of course being a vegan establishment, most of their menu is based on both. Sadface!I wanted to maximize the variety of food and eat something warm, so I ordered the cornbread, a small chilli bowl, a creamsicle smoothie and a side of coconut bacon. The cornbread is not really an appetizer, it's massive, 4 sticks of bread + sauce! Umf. It's surprisingly sweet, with peppers baked in. Not at all what I expected since I come from a garlic cornbread background. The chilli was good, but not remarkable. Now the side of vegan bacon is pretty massive. Delicious, crispy, actually close to bacon in flavour, but sooo salty! I'd actually recommend not ordering it at your table and instead buying it at their store, it's a lot cheaper. The smoothie was the highlight of my meal, and made a fantastic dessert: the taste is exactly that of an orange creamsicle, but with only vegan goodness inside.The space is beautiful, and surprisingly homey, that being said, my waitress was surly and oddly avoidant. Minus points! I left ridiculously full, and a bit miffed. They do seem to have delicious desserts, so I guess that'd be a nice occasion to change my mind..

It's odd that I haven't reviewed Aux Vivres yet. Maybe in an alternate universe I did, but anyway, just to make sure I'd like to note that the bright clean design, the light wood benches, the relaxed funny staff, the leafy back terrasse and convenient takeout counter are all soul soothing. Most welcome though is the hit of fresh, healthy, and tasty always to be found here. The dragon bowl and vegan bacon are my usual picks, but my personal highlight is the creamsicle smoothie. Coconut juice and all manner of healthy things winningly combined to taste exactly like those orangey ice creamsicles you remember from sunny kid days at Grandmas (If you don't have this memory you can borrow mine and then go to Aux Vivres to re-live it. I hope you enjoy!)

Vegan comfort food with great deserts and a liquor license.Prompt service regardless of how busy it is. Delicious smoothies- particularly the chocolate one and the blue monkey. Big portions- awesome for lunches.(French-Canadian translation)

As a vegan who has lived in some extremely vegan-friendly cities , Montreal's most famous vegan restaurant is nice but nothing spectacular.The positivies are that even though it is always busy, the service is very quick and friendly. The menu is huge with something for everyone, and it is very reasonably priced.The food itself is good but can lack flavour . The salads and bowls are large and fresh, but often rely on the (pretty good) sauces for flavour. I also have had a burger which was pretty stodgy and dry, as were the wedges that accompanied it .The best part of my meals there are the smoothies, the creamsicle is particularly good!
Another place to fall in love with! The menu is varied and original,  place has a nice ambiance and staff is friendly!  Loved it !
This vegan joint is truly a treat. The food is decidedly delicious, and the service is truly outstanding.

The tempeh skewers with peanut sauce is amazing. I also ordered one of the bowls which was very large, you can definitely pack up half and save it for another meal. The servers were friendly and atmosphere is very unique.

I do not care if you are vegan, vegetarian, carnivore or omnivore, but you have to try this restaurant out!I came here on a Saturday night with a friend and here's how it went:Pros:- Extremely friendly staff, smiles on everyone's faces- No wait or minimal wait to get seated- Fast service (Saturday night from appy to dessert took us only 45 minutes)- Delicious smoothies! I had a Bombay Banana smoothie and miss awesome had a zesty lime-celeri smoothie (forgot name). They were made on spot and were refreshing!- Generous portions: had us rolling after we were done- Food? YUM. We had the large Chili and a Mekong sandwich and we couldn't finish them all. But we saved space for a choco-banana cake! Cons:- Price-wise is alright but not too shabby!- Mekong's peanut butter sauce was a bit on the sweet side, but not that bad!Extras:I am actually omnivore but I really enjoyed it! I will definitely return. Thank you Aux Vivres for being vegan-friendly.

Alright. I found it. The best vegetarian restaurant in Montreal (and believe me, I've spent a lot of time and money searching).We had the sampler plate of spreads, served with warm chapati. We were blown away by the beauty and creativity of it. Tofu cream? How cute! Olive tapenade - mindblowingly delicious. We promised ourselves we'd eat lightly - but everything disappeared! Who stole the chapati? We couldn't have eaten all that?! Ok, ok, fine. We just had to.My dragon bowl is what I wish every meal could be. Warm, filling, delicious, and exciting. Hello, delicious, incredibly unique and inimitable sauce! Where did you come from? Can I marry you? Why is my friend kissing her BLT? Does she want to marry it too?There's also great music playing and a great, brightly-lit atmosphere. Waiters are all warm and attentive. The desserts make symphonies resound in your head for hours.Next time I'm bringing my sleeping bag and never leaving.

Awesome vegan restaurant giving me a feeling where i can get re-energize not only with the bright decor but also with the colourful food they served.  The Mekong sandwich with the peanut sauce is so yummy and the portion are big.  And the desserts are not too sweet. I love it. Definitely will come back.

This place was awesome. Came here for the first time yesterday, had the Bombay banana smoothie which was amazing, as well as the dragon bowl. The servers were very accommodating, and patient with us foreigners. I would highly recommend this place.

We dined at this restaurant and tried about 4 dishes, all of them were fine but its more a lunch place then for dinner.    I wouldnt come here expecting a gourmet dinner, but i would come again for a simple lunch!

We loved Aux Vivres! The Caesar salad, mixed dip platter, and the potato wedges with chipotle mayo were all so flavorful and fresh. We wish we lived in Montreal so we could go back regularly. THAT CASHEW CHEESE!

The amount of vegan options at this restaurant was amazing! Absolutely everything!! It's a relief to be able to go into a restaurant not have to pick and choose and ask 1 million questions. I was only in Montreal for the weekend and I went to days in a row! Love this place I highly recommend

My group of friends decided to try this place out since one of the members is a vegetarian and said that the menu looked amazing. It certainly smelled like it upon walking in, and it was surprisingly less crowded than I expected it to be, so getting a table of four was relatively easy. The menu itself was so large and diverse, so don't worry about not having any solid options because there's something for everyone.Three of us decided to get smoothies to start, and we ordered the Tropicalia, the Blue Monkey, and the Mango Lassi (I'm not exactly sure why it's under smoothies but okay I guess???). Each of them were delectable and definitely required some sort of self-control to not drink them all at once. In addition, I got a malai kofta appetizer, and it tasted wonderfully homey and divine with the combination of chickpeas, various spices, and the sauce that they were cooked in. My friend also got the Tom Yum  soup, which I found to be flavorful, but she said that she felt they OD'd on the ginger a bit.For our main meals, I got the Aux Vivres Burger while my friend got the Mexicali plate and the other two got the Bombay Thali. The burger was really tasty and clearly was made with fresh ingredients, but I felt that it kind of fell apart quite easily so that I was left with a quarter of the patty and one bun by the end. Also, the coleslaw wasn't the best that I've had, but they do serve up some mean roasted potato wedges that I still dream about. All of my friends seemed to like their individual plates, although my friends who had the thali didn't eat the salad on them because they don't consider it "real food" hahaha.I skipped dessert this time, but two of my friends ordered the chocolate cake and apple pie. The chocolate cake was served in a really thick slice and was really good, but the apple pie was served in a really flat and thin slice? Both were priced the same as well.Aux Vivres is one of the better vegan dining places I've been to in Montréal, although it can get slightly expensive. While it's by no means a completely cravings-free substitution of meat, it does a decent job of creating spinoffs of classic world dishes that are delicious in their own right.

I love this place and I'm not even vegan. I'm no where near vegan but I leave here completely satisfied. The service, the food and the price are fantastic. My 9 yr old daughter loves it too. I may become vegan if all the V food tastes this good.... Well probably not but I can contemplate it now without getting the shivers. So eat here and enjoy feeling almost vegan. I have a false sense of vegan smugness that is completely temporary but good.

This place is a decent vegan restaurant but today i found a 1" piece of plastic in my salad and it reminded me of the time they had to close for 2 months because one of their employees lost his arm in the bread maker.

We had brunch here on a weekday during a quick trip to Montreal. As we entered, we were surprised at how busy the restaurant was, but we were actually seated and served rather quickly.We ordered:-earl grey tea -blt wrap-Mexican soul food plate (forgot the actual name of it- sorry!) The tea came in a pot and I wasn't given and creamer or milk with it. This was a bit disappointing but the tea on its own had a great depth of flavour, which made up for the lack of soy milk.The BLT wrap was giant in portion size and very filling. It was well enjoyed and was balanced in its flavours and textures.The Mexican soul food plate had chilli, brown rice, salad, and corn tortillas. This dish was gluten free and I highly recommend it. Extremely filling, delicious, well seasoned, and incredible value. The food was served extremely quickly and managed to maintain a beautiful presentation still. The staff knows what they're doing at all times- they were very attentive and made sure every guest was taken care of.Highly recommend for quick vegan meal with gluten free options in the city! I hope to be back to try the weekend brunch!

Good vegan food! I am happy there is an all vegan restaurant in Montreal. Au Vivre has a good size menu, the huevos rancheros for the weekend brunch menu are so good. Good coffee as well and great combinations for fresh juices, the popeye is green power and delicious.  They also offer cakes and desserts, I am excited to try some f those.The restaurant itself has a diner feeling to it.  Nothing special.  The service is good and fast.Prices are reasonable.  Overall, a good vegan option!

Aux Vivres is by far my favourite vegan restaurant in Montreal. I really want to try out more dishes, but the gyro pita and mexicali plate are so good that I never want to order anything else. Even my carnivore brother & boyfriend love the chilli. I also love that they have a take-out store. Vegan tzaziki? YES PLEASE. Chocolate chip cookies? YES PLEASE. It's all soooooooooooo good. Aux Vivres makes being vegan a breeze.

Being able to get a healthy dinner at 10 in the evening - priceless. I go to this place whenever I am in Montreal for business and I always come for a late dinner. (Never been there before 9pm)The staff is friendly, the food is great. I always try the soup of the day and know all the items on the menu by now. Also, the quantities of food are large, I simply love it.

This is one of my favorite restaurants hands down. Even if you're not big into vegan food, you will enjoy this place. The Thai bowl is very delicious with a great combination of raw ingredients like the carrot and lettuce and the warm like the rice. The peanut sauce tops it off quite nicelty. The service is great, ask for Melissa.

When traveling, it's always hard to find great healthy food that's easy to grab and go. In Montreal - Aux Vivres is not only a great place for good food, but a must try if you even remotely like vegetables. Their Dragon Bowl was amazing. Great mix of veggies with brown rice. The food was so good I picked up a bunch on my way bag for my veggie roommate. She's now in love with their veggie burgers, so it looks like I'll have to head back to Montreal shortly to bring more great vegan food back home.

I don't eat here very often because my boyfriend is allergic to soy and nuts (I know, I know -- poor me :( ) BUT when I do come to Aux Vivres I milk it for what it's worth. First, what I like about Aux Vivres is that the staff is always very welcoming and friendly, the establishment is always clean, and they have booths (a.k.a privacy). You always see a mixture of people from stay-at-home moms in Lululemons, hipsters, tourists, yogis, business people that work in the hood, etc. so it's wonderful for people watching while you're waiting for your meal (in the privacy of your booth, obviously...) Recommended dishes (and drinks): Bombay Banane smoothie (I swear that I hear the voice of angels singing when this drink is brought to me), corn bread and the Dragon Bowl with tempeh (mmm..).The brunch is always solid -- le complet is delicious - to reduce the soy intake, I like to have palenta rather than scrambled tofu for an additional 2$ - and the pancakes are tasty and filling (order with appetite).Also! According to my friends who love Aux Vivres as much as I do, the BLT sandwich and the carrot cake come STRONGLY recommended for all you fat vegans/vegetarians/omnivores out there. My only complaint about Aux Vivres is that it's always busy and you may have to wait for seating ;) Enjoy!

Omg I want to try everything on this menu! I hope I get to go back before the end of my trip!The wrap portions look humongous!So many starters to choose from... I started with the Tom Yum soup, and the Tempeh Satay served with spicy peanut sauce. Wow yum yum yum!!! Then I had the Chili with roasted potatoes as my main, soooo good! Of course I had plenty of leftovers to take home.My friends had the Dragon Bowl and the Mexicali Plate and they were all equally satisfied. I was actually a little bit surprised about their UNcheesecake, I usually love vegan cheesecake but this one definitely wasn't one of my top faves.This place is nothing fancy, just quality clean ingredients and good vegan comfort food. And reasonably priced, so it's perfect for an everyday lunch or simple dinner! Very happy :).

Great food here! There were so many good looking options, which did make making a decision hard. We got the Bombay smoothie which had masala in it, yum! We also got the spread platter served with chapati, probably my favorite. We ended the meal with the Thai peanut bowl, which was also very fresh, yet hearty. Servings are large so you get quite full even though ingredients are plant based.We went on a Monday during the lunch hour and they were so busy the servers were literally almost running around. The service was slower than what you would expect, but it was fine given we're on vacation.

This was sooo yummy! I had the blueberry pancakes and my boyfriend had the huevos rancheros. The service was lovely and our waitress was super sweet and nice. The place was clean and so were the restrooms. This was our first time in Canada and I was so happy to find various vegan food places. I'm vegan and my boyfriend is vegetarian. I definitely want to come back here and try more of their food, I highly recommend it!

Found this place on Yelp. My vegetarian boyfriend said it was his favorite meal in Montreal! He got the Aux Vivres burger, and I had the Chana Chapati sandwich -- both were great. I also tried the Bombay Banane smoothie to begin and we shared tempeh satay. Excellent! We had a reservation. Service was excellent - one small irritant was that after we were seated, it took about 20 minutes for a server to come over. Other parties came in and were seated and served before anyone came over. But overall, excellent food at this busy restaurant!

Trekked in the snow just try out this renown Montreal vegetarian restaurant, definitely worth it! Food was delicious and well priced. I had the kosmos plate which curved all my cravings, and first time trying tempeh was so yummy! Both me and my friend was amazed by the rich, smooth chocolate apple cake, and was even more so when finding out that the secret ingredient was zucchini. Definitely recommend everyone to try, vegan or not

Get the dragon bowl! I got a burger when I came here (which is not bad), but when I took a little sample of my friend's dragon bowl...oh the regret! Definitely coming back here to devour the whole thing myself. The decor here is simple and clean. The waitress who served us was very helpful in giving us recommendations and we had a nice little chat about that secret sauce in that dragon bowl too. I heard their smoothies are pretty awesome, so there's another thing to add to my "to try" list.

LA POLENTA: This is only on the brunch menu. The polenta wasn't as flavored as I'd hoped it would be, but I loved this plate for brunch. It's so good and definitely filling but not in a way where you need a nap after.DRAGON BOWL: Oh my glob, so good. That sauce though... It's a huge bowl of veggies with an amazing sauce. I don't know what kind of food they have in the afterlife, but I hope it's a shit ton of this. I want to try ALL OF THE BOWLS. Scratch that - I WANT TO TRY THE ENTIRE MENU.THE PLACE: It's big and friendly. Is friendly a word you can use to describe a place? I don't know, but I love Aux Vivres. I want one in LA. Now. Also there's a to-go location next door. I wish I took advantage of that.

Came here for a lunch on a Sunday around 11:30am- surprisingly no major line up!We ate:- Mexicali plate (3/5): the guac was awesome, but the chilli was cold and lacking the wow factor. A+ tortilla!- Portobelo mushroom burger (3/5): While the mushroom itself was delish, the toppings and potatoes left more to be desired.- Fresh apple juice : (4/5) umm 6$?Overall it was okay,  but I could find these dishes at other non-speciality Restos and it would be probably better. Ps. Upon leaving at 1ish there was a crazy line!!!

One of the most legit vegan restaurants I've ever been to, period! And I've been to many! The bowls are fan.fucking.tastic. And I'm an unapologetic omni. I could turn veg if I had access to this place on a regular basis. I love bowls with raw veg in them for some reason and they make it so, so, so, good and not like some cheap imitation of omni food.

I'm not a vegetarian but I enjoyed my meal here. I had waffles for brunch. Wasn't crazy about the soy "bacon" but the rest was really good. Haven't been back in a while but would recommend even if you aren't vegan.

I went to Aux Vivres with my parents (who are vegan) and we weren't too impressed. The dishes had exotic flavors which I appreciated, but I didn't leave satisfied at all.We had the dragon bowl, the buddha bowl with tempeh and the coconut blt wrap. All were okay. I probably wouldn't go back.

Ok, I'm addicted to the Vege Pate.I had to run over to their take-out shop next door and buy some for home.Aux Vivres was one of the best meals I had in Montreal.Everything is vegan and perfectly executed.I had the dragon bowl because I wanted to try this dragon sauce that  I have heard so much about.  It was creamy, nutty, rich, and soooo good.The bowl was so big I couldn't finish it!  Beets, carrot, red cabbage, daikon, lettuce,sprouts, and in-house made tempeh ($13.50).As for fresh juices, the Popeye (5.95/7.50) was a magical spicy blend of cucumber, celery, apple, lemon, cayenne pepper.I'm totally coming back here next time I'm in town!
One of my favorite vegan place in Montreal.. Big menu with a lot of options!! The BLT wrap is sooo good!!! If you are for the brunch...try Los Huevos Rancheros.

Came here for brunch on the weekend, which was busy. I got the yogurt with granola. It was my first time trying nondairy yogurt, and it was actually really good. I would definitely go for one of the veggie bowls next time, which was what my friend got and it looked so good. I also got a mango smoothie; I was hoping that the smoothie was thicker though.

This post will be like most other on here, I'm going to sing the praises of the aux vivres BLT, it's simply the best sandwich I've ever had. I will say that I have almost perfect this sandwich myself all that's off is the chapatti bread, I can't seem to make it the same way. The coconut bacon, has a smokey, sweet and salty flavour, as well as a slightly greasy aspect to it because of the fat in coconut. The secret to that sandwich is the vegan butter sauce that they spread on the chapatti before applying the vegan mayo, Bacon, lettuce and tomato.  I've also tried there new breakfast burrito, it's great, a generous portion plus a coffee or tea for 5$. Other items I've had include, the portobello burger, the channa wrap, veggie lox, the veggie pate, chilli, faux cheese cake, choco banana pie, many smoothies and fresh juices.  I've been here 20+ times in the past 3-4 years, I've never had a bad meal, the only thing I hate about going to aux vivres is when my meal comes to an end, I just never want to leave. I've been a vegetarian for about 8 years and   I'm trying to be a vegan, this restaurant makes it that much easier.

I bring all my friends here. My favorite foods for take out are : The veggie butter is amazing and a great addition to a sandwich or just a plain bread. Coconut bacon is an awesome meat alternative. The texture and flavor is so unique and very distinctive, you can add in your salad, to give it am extra crunch My only issue with aux vivre is the Indian food, maybe my standard are a bit high . I have eaten Indian food my whole life and I know what it is suppose to taste like. There is little to know flavor and the chickpeas are always hard. My friends that visited me from India agreed with me.

Always busy...even on Monday nights!A sign that there is not enough vegan restaurant in Montreal...Vegan fares that will make you come back for more...not all dishes are a hit in my opinion but some are highly addictive! Try the pate samples with chapati or the dragon bowl.The vege lox is quite surprising, it does really taste like smoke salmon! Delicious smoothies and fresh juices! Friendly service. That's all you need to know!

LOVED it.  Amazing Vegan food, huge portions, good prices.  The place is super crowded, we went for Sunday brunch, and luckily found a seat.  The service was super quick (if not a bit rushed, but I get it, they were busy), food came quickly, and service was good. No complaints here.  I had the big breakfast with tempeh bacon, tofu scramble, cornbread and sweet potatoes.  Very filling, and kept me energetic and going all day.What a treat to have the creamer be soy creamer!!  Very exciting to be able to pour cream in my coffee!!Very exciting to find a Vegan restaurant in Montreal!!

Aux Vivres is one of the few vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Montreal and is located on St. Laurent. It's a great option if you're looking for healthy, fresh and tasty cuisine. The restaurant itself reminds me of a dinner (so it's very casual), and the staff were very friendly. I think they have a terrace somewhere but.... I didn't see it so maybe that's just a rumor ;-)I started with the Tonic (ginger, lemon, apple) - my immediate reaction was to purse my lips and widen my eyeballs because DAMN it was tart! But it was refreshingly delicious once I got over my sensory shock!As a meal, I opted for Le Complet (tofu scramble, Tempeh bacon, cornbread,fresh fruit, salad and sweet potatoes). The tofu scramble was good - I liked the texture and flavor. The cornbread was delicious, as were the sweet potatoes. The salad came with this amazing Dill vinaigrette that was so good, I bought a bottle before leaving. The Tempeh bacon did nothing for me. I can't say I enjoyed the taste or texture at all.  Overall, the portion size was quite good (for me, anyway) and the price was appropriate ($11 for the plate).  I plan to go back and try one of their infamous bowls - I've heard they're amazing!They have a small shop out front where you can be pre-made meals, or other items like their vinaigrette, baked goods etc.

Really good, different food. Highly recommend the mezze aux vivres and the chile! The tom yum soup wasn't the typical tom yum but still tasted very good. The food arrives very very quickly and service made the experience even better as everyone was pleasant to talk too!

Oh man. This place. The French Canadians really know how to make a Jewish vegan New Yorker's dream come true. Vegan lox! Do I need to say more?! My childhood...and that butter! I've tried to smoke carrots myself, but to no great end result. If I lived in Montreal, I would likely be here every day. Everything was delicious! The living salad was insanely delicious. I actually couldnt stop eating, I ate everything....Top top top vegan find ever and I have traveled everywhere in the states. Merci, MERCI!

Food was excellent but the service was very slow. I went for brunch on a Sunday and was able to sit down pretty quickly. First course came out fast. We ordered food to go when we ordered our breakfast, but waited an excessively long period of time to get our to go order, and then waited even longer to get our check. But the staff was extremely friendly and the prices were very reasonable considering the large portions given.

Outstanding food, sensational service, and superb company made this a place to remember.  The staff is friendly, efficient, and generous with the coffee, and even the most finicky eater will find a favourite here. I had a Bombay banane smoothie to start, with sweet dates and spicy ginseng blended with cream soy coconut milk.  Indulgent yet light, and the perfect accompaniment to a generous portion of chick pea curry that I inhaled whilst awaiting my friends.  The curry was savoury and nourishing, and could easily satisfy a lunch time craving by itself.  I had a Bouddha bowl for my entrée, and it was more than I could eat even if I'd begun on an empty stomach, so yay for leftovers!  The vegetables were perfectly steamed and crisp, with an excellent Japanese sauce that blended well with the fresh veggies and brown rice as well.  My friends shared a stunning cornbread starter with vegan butter, and fresh green salad, and BLT that quite honestly made me wish I'd heeded their advice. Arriving on a fresh chapati, the layers of juicy tomatoes, verdant lettuce, vegan mayonnaise, and coconut bacon, had me transfixed on what I could only imagine to be the best tasting vegan sandwich ever.  My friends seemed to know, yet didn't offer even a single bite.  Well played.
